intro: Flaveria integrifolia, commonly known as the slender ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract various pollinators. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including disturbed soils and open areas, and is often found in the United States and parts of Mexico. Flaveria integrifolia is also known for its potential ecological importance and is sometimes used in ecological studies.
